main_text:
Objections || The Incompleteness Objection
6.1 The Incompleteness Objection

Many critics of public justification claim it cannot address critical
political issues. This problem arises from restrictions on permissible
reasoning in public life. (De Marneffe 1994, Reidy 2000; Schwartzman
2004). Critics here object to consensus views, which restrict the set
of justifying reasons. Citizens may not have shared reasons and
instead appeal to personal considerations, so the convergence view
makes this objection less pressing.
